enWisdom: Contentment is continence
Contentment is the better of the two forms of continence

Wisdom: أَلَا وَإِنَّ الْقَنَاعَةَ وَغَلَبَةَ الشَّهْوَةِ مِنْ أَكْبَرِ الْعَفَافِ
enWisdom: Indeed contentment and overcoming lustful desires are from the greatest forms of abstinence
The goodness of contentment stems from continence
Contentment is proportionate to the degree of continence
Every contented one is continent

Wisdom: مَنْ قَنِعَتْ نَفْسُهُ أَعَانَتْهُ عَلَى النَّزَاهَةِ وَالْعَفَافِ
enWisdom: One whose soul is content is assisted by it to become pure and remain chaste

Wisdom: مَنِ اقْتَنَعَ بِالْكَفَافِ أَدَّاهُ إِلَى الْعَفَافِ
enWisdom: One who is content with that which suffices is led by it towards virtue
The most at ease among the people is the contented one
Contentment is the [path to the] most comfortable lifestyle
The contented one is saved from the woes of covetousness

Wisdom: اقْنَعُوا بِالْقَلِيلِ مِنْ دُنْيَاكُمْ لِسَلَامَةِ دِينِكُمْ فَإِنَّ الْمُؤْمِنَ الْبُلْغَةُ الْيَسِيرَةُ مِنَ الدُّنْيَا تُقْنِعُهُ
enWisdom: Be content with little from your worldly possessions for the safety of your religion, for indeed the believer is satisfied with the little that he gets of this world

Wisdom: أَنْعَمُ النَّاسِ عَيْشاً مَنْ مَنَحَهُ اللَّهُ سُبْحَانَهُ الْقَنَاعَةَ وَأَصْلَحَ لَهُ زَوْجَهُ
enWisdom: The person with the most blessed lifestyle is one who has been granted contentment by Allah, the Glorified, and who has been given a good wife

Wisdom: إِنَّ أَهْنَأَ النَّاسِ عَيْشاً مَنْ كَانَ بِمَا قَسَمَ اللَّهُ لَهُ رَاضِياً
enWisdom: Verily the person who has the happiest life of all people is one who is satisfied with what Allah has apportioned for him

Wisdom: ثَمَرَةُ الْقَنَاعَةِ الْإِجْمَالُ فِي الْمُكْتَسَبِ وَالْعُزُوفُ عَنِ الطَّلَبِ
enWisdom: The fruit of contentment is being moderate in earning [one’s livelihood] and refraining from asking [others]
Counter greed with contentment

Wisdom: عَلَيْكَ بِالْعَفَافِ وَالْقُنُوعِ فَمَنْ أَخَذَ بِهِ خَفَّتْ عَلَيْهِ الْمُؤَنُ
enWisdom: Espouse chastity and contentment, for whoever does this, his burden of sustenance is lightened

Wisdom: كُلُّ مُؤَنِ الدُّنْيَا خَفِيفَةٌ عَلَى الْقَانِعِ وَالْعَفِيفِ
enWisdom: Every provision of this world is trivial for the contented and the chaste

Wisdom: لَنْ تُوجَدَ الْقَنَاعَةُ حَتَّى يُفْقَدَ الْحِرْصُ
enWisdom: Contentment will never be attained until greed is lost
One who makes himself content becomes contented
One who is content does not get depressed
Whoever is content, his worship becomes good
Whoever is content, his greed becomes less
One who is granted contentment is preserved by it
